For a list of all items and upgrades within the Construction skill, see Construction/Level up table.

Hall (quest trophies)

A quest hall in a player-owned house is a room where the player can display quest achievements and awards. This room can be created with level 35 Construction and 25,000.

There are 8 hotspots available:

  • Bookcase space
  • Guild trophy space
  • Landscape space
  • Map space
  • Portrait space
  • Rug space
  • Stair space
  • Sword space

Contents

  • 1 Bookcase
  • 2 Guild trophy
  • 3 Landscape
  • 4 Map
  • 5 Portrait
  • 6 Rugs/Stairs
  • 7 Sword

Bookcase[edit | edit source]

Removing a bookcase does not destroy any of the books stored.

Level Bookcase Materials Experience Cost
4 Wooden bookcase Plank x4
Nails x4 		115 864 - 4,252[1]
29 Oak bookcase Oak plank x3 180 1,416
40 Mahogany bookcase Mahogany plank x3 420 6,612
  1. â†‘ Cost changes depending on the type of nails used.

Guild trophy[edit | edit source]

An amulet of glory (t) cannot be put as a trophy. A wall-mounted amulet of glory can be used an unlimited number of times without the need to recharge. A wall-mounted mythical cape provides unlimited teleports players to the centre of the Myths' Guild. If a teleporting player is poisoned, the glory/cape also cures the poison and heals the player by the amount of damage the poison would have dealt next. If wall-mounted items are removed, the trophy items are recovered.

Many players like to place a quest hall with a mounted amulet of glory beside a chapel, providing fast teleports to Edgeville bank for rapid Prayer training. This room combination is also popular in player killers' houses due to the ability to quickly recharge prayer and teleport using the mounted amulet of glory.

Level Guild trophy Materials Experience Cost Quest(s) Required
47 Anti-dragon shield Teak plank x3
Anti-dragon shield 		280 2,938 Dragon Slayer I
47 Amulet of glory Teak plank x3
Amulet of glory (uncharged) 		290 15,134 N/A

47 Mythical cape Teak plank x3
Mythical cape 		370 12,838 Dragon Slayer II

Landscape[edit | edit source]

Landscapes are purchased from Sir Renitee who resides on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of Falador Castle for 2,000. They require the completion of certain quests to be purchased. If removed later the landscape will be lost.

Map[edit | edit source]

Maps are purchased from Sir Renitee who resides on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of Falador Castle for 1,000 and require 51, 101, or 151 quest points for a small, medium, or large map respectively.

Level Map Materials Experience Cost
38 Small map Teak plank x2
Small map (item) 		211 2,892
58 Medium map Mahogany plank x3
Medium map (item) 		451 7,612
78 Large map Mahogany plank x4
Large map (item) 		591 9,816

Portrait[edit | edit source]

Portraits are purchased from Sir Renitee who resides on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of Falador Castle for 1,000. They require the completion of certain quests to be purchased. If removed later the portrait will be lost.

Level Portrait Materials Experience Cost Quest(s) Required

Arthur portrait 		211 2,892 Holy Grail

35 Giant Dwarf Teak plank x2
Keldagrim portrait 		211 2,892 The Giant Dwarf
55 Miscellanians Mahogany plank x2
Misc. portrait 		311 5,408 Throne of Miscellania

Rugs/Stairs[edit | edit source]

A staircase added to a Quest Hall on the ground floor will prompt the player to build it "Up" or "Down". When building an "Up" staircase, then attempting to climb the staircase, the Construction interface will ask if the player want to add a room at the top of the staircase. The rooms available at the top are either a skill hall or another quest hall. If the player builds a "Down" staircase, the player will have an additional option of building a dungeon stairs room.
